message.entry: {0} and {1} must be vectors of the same length, matrices of the same size, or a combination of a vector and a matrix where the length of the vector matches either the number of rows or columns of the matrix.
S must be a scalar or a vector of the same length as X.
Color must be one RGB triplet, an m-by-3 matrix of RGB triplets with one color per scatter point, or an m-by-1 vector with one value per scatter point.
Must supply X and Y data as first arguments.
Area and color arguments must be numeric or objects which can be converted to double.
Trailing input arguments must occur in name-value pairs.
CData must be an RGB triplet.
Tall inputs must be real column vectors.
Invalid jitter values. Specify density jitter type in one dimension for 2-D scatter, or in two dimensions for 3-D scatter.
Specify only one named color or use an m-by-3 matrix of RGB triplets to specify multiple colors.

{0}, {1}, and size arguments must be vectors of the same length, matrices of the same size, or a mix of vectors and matrices where the length of the vectors matches either the number of rows or columns of the matrices.

X, Y, Z, and size arguments must be vectors of the same length, matrices of the same size, or a mix of vectors and matrices where the length of the vectors matches either the number of rows or columns of the matrices.
To use {0} with a table, specify a table followed by {1} and {2} variables. Size and color can be specified using name-value pairs.
